section.name: Hippo Forge plugins
section.span: Installing plugins from the Hippo forge.
section.p: The Hippo Forge, http://forge.onehippo.org/, is a repository filled with all kinds of useful frontend and repository plugins. In this article, we'll see how we can use the forge to enhance the basic Hippo CMS with additional functionality.

subsection.name: Download the Plugin
subsection.p: We'll use the popular feedbackplugin for the demonstration. Download the latest version of the plugin, hippo-forge-feedbackplugin-1.01.00.jar at the time of this writing. sometime

subsection.name: Extending the EAR
subsection.p: To install the plugin, unzip the EAR package (see Deploying the EAR on how to obtain it)
subsection.source: ~/> mkdir hippo-ear ~/> cd hippo-ear ~/hippo-ear/> unzip ../hippo-ecm-package-ear-2.01.00.13536.ear ~/hippo-ear/> ls commons-collections-3.1.jar commons-lang-2.1.jar hippo-ecm-addon-builtin-common-2.01.00.13536.jar [ ... ] xml-apis-1.3.03.jar ~/hippo-ear/>
subsection.p: Add the JAR to the folder where you unzipped the EAR and rezip it.
You now have an EAR package with the plugin. Deploy it in your Application Server.

subsection.name: Extending the WAR
subsection.p: As in the case of the EAR, unzip the WAR package (see Deploying the WAR again on how to obtain the package)
subsection.source: ~/> mkdir hippo-war ~/> cd hippo-war ~/hippo-war/> unzip ../hippo-ecm-package-war-2.01.00.13536.ear ~/hippo-war/> ls index.html META-INF/ skin/ WEB-INF/ xinha/ ~/hippo-war/> ls WEB-INF/lib commons-collections-3.1.jar [ ... ] xml-apis-1.3.03.jar ~/hippo-war/>
subsection.p: Add the JAR to the WEB-INF/lib folder and rezip the WAR.
You now have an WAR package with the plugin. Deploy it in your servlet container.

subsection.name: Deploy the Bundle (planned)
subsection.p: A future OSGi packaging of Hippo ECM will allow you to deploy the plugin to a (running) OSGi container.

subsection.name: Customizing the CMS configuration
subsection.p: Open the console with administrative privileges, i.e. log in to http://localhost:8080/cms/console as admin (default password admin). Navigate to the /hippo:configuration/hippo:frontend/cms/cms-static/logoutPlugin node.
Change the class name in the "plugin.class" property to org.hippoecm.forge.feedbackplugin.FeedbackPlugin and save the node (click "Save" with the logoutPlugin node selected).
